member.name: T:SuperConsole.CmdArgs
member.summary: Class for parsing command line arguments. The arguments must start with either '-' or '/'.

member.name: M:SuperConsole.CmdArgs.ParseArgs(System.String[])
member.summary: Parses out command line arguments into a Dictionary with the keys being the arg and the value being the followup to the argument, if any. Use this if you don't care what arguments are being used.

member.name: M:SuperConsole.CmdArgs.TryParseArgs(System.String[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String}@)
member.summary: Tries to parse out the command line arguments validating them with the given args
member.returns: true if successful and all args are valid; otherwise false

member.name: T:SuperConsole.Point
member.summary: System.Drawing.Point equivalent class for Console programs

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Point.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new Point object

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Point.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new empty Point object

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Point.IsEmpty
member.summary: Determines if Point is empty
member.returns: True if X-coordinate and Y-coordinate are 0; otherwise false

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Point.Offset(SuperConsole.Point)
member.summary: Offsets the Point by the given Point's values

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Point.Offset(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Offsets the Point by the given x- and y-coordinates

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Point.X
member.summary: X-coordinate

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Point.Y
member.summary: Y-coordinate

member.name: T:SuperConsole.Rectangle
member.summary: System.Drawing.Rectangle equivalent class for Console programs

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Rectangle.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new Rectangle at the given X/Y-coordinates and Width and Height

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Rectangle.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new Rectangle with X/Y-coordinates, Width, and Height set to 0

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Transform(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the Rectangles Width and Height by the given x and y values

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Move(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the Rectangles X- and Y-coordinates by the given x and y values

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Rectangle.IsEmpty
member.summary: Determines if Rectangle is empty
member.returns: True if Width and Height are 0

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Offset(SuperConsole.Rectangle)
member.summary: Offsets the Rectangle by the given Rectangle's values

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Offset(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Offsets the Rectangle by the given x/y-coordinates, Width, and Height

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Rectangle.X
member.summary: X-coordinate (Left)

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Y
member.summary: Y-coordinate (Top)

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Width
member.summary: Width

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Height
member.summary: Height

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Right
member.summary: Right-coordinate

member.name: P:SuperConsole.Rectangle.Bottom
member.summary: Bottom-coordinate

member.name: T:SuperConsole.Cmd
member.summary: Custom methods for reading and manipulating the standard console window

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.CenterConsoleToScreen
member.summary: Centers the console window on the primary monitor

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.Fill(System.ConsoleColor,System.ConsoleColor)
member.summary: Fills the entire console window with the specified background color and changes color of all characters to specified foreground color then resets the background and foreground colors to previous values

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.Fill(System.ConsoleColor,System.ConsoleColor,SuperConsole.Rectangle)
member.summary: Fills an area of the console window with the specified background color and changes color of all characters to specified foreground color then resets the background and foreground colors to previous values

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.Fill(System.ConsoleColor,System.ConsoleColor,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fills an area of the console window with the specified background color and changes color of all characters to specified foreground color then resets the background and foreground colors to previous values

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.ReadCharAt(SuperConsole.Point)
member.summary: Gets nullable char at console position
member.returns: character at coordinates or null if blank

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.ReadCharAt(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets nullable char at console position
member.returns: character at coordinates or null if blank

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.SetCharAt(System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a character at the specified location

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.SetCharAt(System.Char,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.ConsoleColor,System.ConsoleColor)
member.summary: Writes a character at the specified location using the given background and foreground colors

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.ClearConsoleChar(SuperConsole.Point)
member.summary: Clears the character from the console at the given point

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.ClearConsoleChar(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears the character from the console at the given x,y coordinates

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.ClearConsoleRow
member.summary: Clears the current row of the Console window

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.ClearConsoleRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Clears the specified row of the Console window

member.name: M:SuperConsole.Cmd.EnterPassword
member.summary: Prompts user to "Enter Password: " then allows user to enter password masking characters with "*".
